type.title: Short title.
type.context: CROPS AND LIVESTOCK REGISTRATION ACT under Short title. 1.  This Act may be cited as the Crops and Livestock Registration Act.
type.description: This Act may be cited as the Crops and Livestock Registration Act.

type.name: section
type.title: Interpretation.
type.context: CROPS AND LIVESTOCK REGISTRATION ACT under Interpretation. 2.  In this Act, land means any area of land whereof there is at least one acre under some form of cultivation.
type.description: In this Act, land means any area of land whereof there is at least one acre under some form of cultivation.

(1) On or before the last day of January in each year the occupier of any land shall furnish to the Chief LAWS OF GUYANA 4 Cap. 68:04 Crops and Livestock Registration   L.R.O. 1/2012 livestock. Schedule.  Forms A and B. Occupier of land.   Owner of livestock.                                 Lessor or licensor.      Agricultural Officer a return, in Form A in the Schedule, of the acreage of the land under cultivation at the date of the return, and of the crops (and produce thereof) of any of the agricultural products set out in that form reaped during the year ending on that date. (2) The owner of any livestock kept on land shall in like manner furnish a return thereof in Form B in the Schedule, setting out the number of animals kept at the date of the return and their increase during the year ending on that date. (3) The form shall be signed by the occupier of the land or the owner of the livestock, as the case may be, together with a declaration that the statement contained in the return is to the best of his knowledge and belief true and accurate.  (4) If the occupier of land or owner of stock is absent from Guyana, his attorney in Guyana shall furnish the return.  (5) The Minister may, by order, substitute from time to time any other day for the last day of January for the return, and may in like manner substitute from time to time any other form for the forms contained in the Schedule.  (6) The return shall give the information required for the twelve months ending one calendar month before the date of the return, but the Minister may from time to time prescribe a different period and also if so advised call for a special return covering any specified period.  (7) When land is given out to farmers on lease or licence, the lessor or licensor may in any case be required by the Chief Agricultural Officer to make the returns in place of the occupier of land or owner of livestock and shall be subject to the like penalties. type.name: section
type.title: Chief Agricultural Officer’s power of entry.
type.context: CROPS AND LIVESTOCK REGISTRATION ACT under Chief Agricultural Officers power of entry. 4. The Chief Agricultural Officer, or anyone authorised by him in that behalf, or a district commissioner, may enter between six in the forenoon and six in the afternoon upon any land respecting which returns are required by this Act after giving seven days previous notice in writing to the occupier of that land or his attorney, and may survey and measure the land or any part thereof or count and inspect the livestock thereon.
